title: Kiwi (people)
summary: "Kiwi" (/ˈkiːwi/ KEE-wee)[1] is a common self-reference used by New Zealanders, though it is also used internationally.[2] Unlike many demographic labels, its usage is not considered offensive; rather, it is generally viewed as a symbol of pride and endearment for most people of New Zealand.[3] However, not all New Zealanders prefer to self-identify with the name.[4]
